snippet: A steam release from a chemical reaction at France’s oldest nuclear power plant gave two workers slight burns on their hands but did not cause a fire or radiation problem, officials said.
abstract: French officials say that a steam release from a chemical reaction at the Fessenheim nuclear power plant, France’s oldest, gave two workers slight burns on their hands but did not cause a fire or radiation problem.
lead_paragraph: A steam release from a chemical reaction at France’s oldest nuclear power plant gave two workers slight burns on their hands but did not cause a fire or radiation problem, officials said.

headline.seo: 2 Injured in Steam Blast at French Nuclear Plant
headline.main: 2 Injured at Power Plant in France
headline.print_headline: 2 Injured At Power Plant In France
